description:
Given an array of integers, its totalCost is calculated as follows, where *n* = the number of elements in the array and the array itself is named element.

'''
currentMaximumElement = element[0]
totalCost =0
for(i=1; i<n; i++){
      if(element[i] > currentMaximumElement){
           currentMaximumElement = element[i]

          totalCost += 1;
      }
}
'''

Given three values n, m, and totalCost, find the number of distinct arrays that meet the following criteria:
* Each array consists of n integers
* 1<=value at index i in each array <= m, where 0<=i<=n
* The cost to find the maximum element of each element of each array is equal to totalCost.

Two arrays are said to be distinct if there exists at least one index i (where 0<=i<n) such that the elements at index i,
are not equal.

#### Input Format:
* first line contains 3 non-negative integers n, m , and totalCost respectively
* second line consists n integers (elements of the array n)
* third line consists m integers (elements of the array m)
* fourth line consists totalCost integers (elements of the array totalCost)

#### Constraints: 
* 1<= q <= 50
* 1<= n[i] <= 50, where 0<= i < q
* 1<= m[i] <= 50, where 0<= i < q
* 0 <= totalCost[i] < n[i], where 0 <= i < q
title: Reconstructing Arrays
